projectPurpose: To provide a unified, highly efficient, and flexible data communication and management layer for distributed systems, unifying data in motion, data in-use, and data at rest, particularly excelling in edge, IoT, and robotics environments.
platforms: Cross-platform (supports various Rust targets, including those for constrained devices)
mainFeatures: Unifies data in motion (pub/sub), data in-use (computations), and data at rest (storage/queries)
Highly efficient: low latency, high throughput, minimal wire overhead
Supports flexible communication topologies (peer-to-peer, routed, brokered)
Designed for resource-constrained environments (IoT, Edge, Robotics)
Includes a lightweight version for microcontrollers (zenoh-pico)

alternatives.name: MQTT
alternatives.license: Open Source (various licenses depending on implementation, e.g., EPL/EDL for Mosquitto)
platforms: Cross-platform (various implementations available for different OS and embedded systems)
mainFeatures: Suitable for IoT and constrained devices

alternatives.name: DDS (Data Distribution Service)
alternatives.license: Open Source and Proprietary (e.g., eProsima Fast DDS - Apache License 2.0, RTI Connext DDS - Proprietary)
platforms: Cross-platform (implementations available for various OS and RTOS)
mainFeatures: Strong focus on performance and reliability

marketPositioning: Eclipse Zenoh positions itself as a highly efficient, next-generation protocol unifying data in motion, data at rest, and computations across the entire computing continuum, from microcontrollers to the cloud. Unlike traditional pub/sub (like MQTT) which is primarily data in motion and broker-dependent, or DDS which focuses on real-time data distribution in specific domains, or Kafka which is a high-throughput distributed log for data streaming often requiring more infrastructure, Zenoh offers a more integrated, flexible, and resource-efficient approach tailored for the challenges of edge computing, IoT, and robotics, supporting diverse topologies and providing built-in data storage and query capabilities.
